{"step_by_step_thinking": "To compare the groups and determine if the changes in plaque volume, LDL-C levels, FEV1/FVC ratio, and ACQ scores from baseline to 12-month follow-up are statistically significant, the most appropriate statistical method would be analysis of variance (ANOVA). ANOVA is used to compare means between three or more groups. In this case, the groups would be the different treatment groups (pulmharkimab 75 mg/d, pulmharkimab 150 mg/d, and placebo).", "answer_choice": "C"}
